question: 1-91 You are driving towards the intersection without a traffic signal or sign. How should you proceed?

options.statement: A motorcycle proceeding from the right might enter the intersection without making a stop. Therefore, you should speed up and travel through the intersection before the motorcycle so as not to collide with it.
Your vehicle has the right of way over a motorcycle coming from the right at the intersection, so you may proceed at the same speed.
You may proceed slowly which allows you to stop anytime while taking care of the motorcycle coming from the right and the motorcycle on the left rear side.

question: 1-92 You are making a right turn at the intersection. There is a truck coming from the opposite direction signaling with the right direction indicator. Also, there is a pedestrian who is crossing the road on the right side. How should you proceed?

options.statement: Be careful because a motorcycle might go straight from behind the truck, proceed to the center of the intersection, stop and ensure the safety of the opposite direction.
Wait until the pedestrian crosses the road and confirm the safety of the opposite lane and start to make a right turn.
The motorcycle in the rear is also signaling to turn right, therefore quickly make a right turn before the truck turns right.

question: 1-93 You have slowed down to 20km/h. What do you need to take care of when driving?

options.statement: There are no vehicles in the rear or on the left rear side, turn the steering wheel once to the right and make a wide left turn at the same speed.
Pedestrians have the right of way so approach the pedestrian crossing slowly on the left side and wait just before the pedestrian crossing until the pedestrians finish crossing.
The oncoming vehicle may make a right turn before my car makes a left turn. I have to make a left turn quickly between the pedestrians at faster speed.

question: 1-94 You are driving at 30 km/h. What do you need to take care of when driving?

options.statement: A child might run out into the road, therefore drive along the left side of the road at a slightly slower speed.
Children playing on the sidewalk will not run out into the road suddenly so you may proceed at the same speed.
Children are unpredictable, therefore honk and proceed at the same speed.

question: 1-95 You are approaching the railroad crossing where there are pedestrians and bicycles on the left side. How should you cross the railroad crossing?

options.statement: If you proceed, there will not be enough safe distance between the pedestrians and bicycles and the large size vehicle coming from the opposite lane. Stop before the railroad crossing and wait until the large size vehicle crosses.
A cyclist might enter the path to overtake the pedestrians, therefore speed up and cross the railroad crossing at once.
As there is not enough space in the railroad crossing, honk and stop the pedestrians and cyclists. You should travel the left side of the road to keep a safe distance between the oncoming vehicles.

question: 3-91 You are traveling at 30 km/h. A motorcycle traveling on the opposite lane is signaling right. What are you going to be careful about when you cross the intersection?

options.statement: It is hard to guess the speed of the motorcycle, and you may misjudge the distance between you and the motorcycle, so you reduce your speed while being careful about the motorcycle.
You expect the motorcycle not to block your way; however, it may turn right suddenly, so you pass through the intersection while being prepared to apply the brakes anytime.
A vehicle is approaching the intersection from the right side, so you reduce your speed and pass through the intersection by checking for traffic.

question: 3-92 You have stopped at the intersection to turn right. What are you going to be careful about?

options.statement: It seems that a bus on the opposite lane may not be able to pass through the intersection due to a vehicle that is trying to turn right, so you turn right immediately before the bus comes.
There are pedestrians who are trying to cross the pedestrian crossing on the right side, so you start to turn right immediately because there is a car behind you.
You cannot confirm the traffic situation behind the bus, so you turn right by checking for traffic after the bus on the opposite lane has passed through the intersection.

question: 3-93 You have reduced your speed to 20 km/h to turn left. In this case, what are you going to be careful about?

options.statement: There is a motorcycle behind you, so you drive by reducing your speed and moving to the edge of the left side on the road while paying attention to the motorcycle behind you.

It is possible that the motorcycle in front of you may swerve to the right side to avoid the car, so you keep a very short distance between you and the car to keep the motorcycle from changing directions.
It is possible that the traffic light may turn yellow when the car in front of you stops behind the pedestrian crossing, so you turn the steering wheel to the right and make a wide left turn.

question: 3-94 You are approaching a railroad crossing on an uphill road. A railroad crossing alarm is not sounding. How are you going to drive?

options.statement: A truck in front of you will start traveling immediately after stopping before the crossing, so you drive by getting as close to the truck as possible.

You cannot confirm a traffic situation after the railroad crossing, so you stop behind the crossing by confirming that you are not going to get stuck in the middle of the crossing after the truck has passed it.

To make sure that you do not wrongly roll back on the uphill road and do not collide with a vehicle behind you, you stop in the middle of the railroad crossing and pass through the crossing by checking for traffic.

question: 3-95 You are traveling at 20 km/h. What are you going to be careful about when there is a parked car ahead?

options.statement: The bicycle will notice you and stop behind the parked car, so you pass the car by accelerating.
It is possible that the bicycle may swerve to the right side when any door of the parked car opens, so you drive at a speed where you can easily stop.

When you continue to travel behind the bicycle and try to pass the parked car, it is possible that someone may come out of the parked car, so you drive by reducing your speed and checking for traffic.

question: 19-91 You are travelling at 30 km/h. What are you going to be careful about when you are about to go straight through the intersection?

options.statement: The pedestrians ahead are about to finish crossing the road, so you keep the same speed and proceed by moving as close to the left side of the intersection as possible while paying attention to the pedestrians.
The intersection has low visibility, so you slow down to make sure that you can stop at the intersection anytime.
You pass through the intersection after watching out for traffic by looking right and left or checking for traffic in the mirror installed at the intersection.

question: 19-92 You are slowing down to turn right at the intersection. The vehicle on the opposite lane is indicating you can turn right now by flashing the headlights. What are you going to be careful about your driving?

options.statement: The bicycle traveling on the opposite lane may be going through the intersection, so you stop at the intersection until the bicycle has finished passing through the intersection.
A motorcycle may suddenly be passing through the intersection from behind the vehicle in the opposite lane, so you stop at the intersection.
You cannot see the pedestrian crossing on the right side even if the headlights are on, so you watch out for traffic carefully.

question: 19-93 You are slowing down to 10 km/h. What are you going to be careful about when you turn left?

options.statement: The bicycle is coming from the right side without its light on and the intersection has poor visibility, so you stop before the intersection and watch out for traffic before turning left.
A vehicle is approaching from behind, so you quickly go through the intersection.

There is a pedestrian on the left side near the intersection and it seems that it may take time for the pedestrian to cross the intersection, so you pass through the intersection before the pedestrian.

question: 19-94 You are driving at 40 km/h and you should have changed to the left lane corner. What are you going to be careful about when you are changing to the left lane?

options.statement: You need to check for traffic on the left lane, so you keep your eyes on the left side and the left side behind you.
A motorcycle is traveling on the left lane and there is a divider ahead. You slow down and indicate changing to the left lane while paying attention to both the motorcycle and the divider.
There is a divider just ahead, so you stop changing lanes and go straight to make a detour.

question: 19-95 You are driving at 30 km/h. A motorcycle stops on the side street on the left side. What are you going to be careful about when you are driving?

options.statement: The bicycle may be pulled by the dog and enter the middle of the road, so you pass the bicycle by entering the opposite lane and accelerating the speed while sounding the horn.
The motorcycle will let the bicycle and your vehicle go first, so you pass the bicycle by keeping the speed.
The motorcycle may come out of the street, so you slow down by paying attention to the motorcycle and you drive behind the bicycle until you pass the side street on the left side.

question: 6-91 You are traveling at 30km/h. What are you going to be careful about when you are about to go straight through the intersection?

options.statement: The pedestrians ahead are about to finish crossing the road so you keep the same speed and proceed by moving as close to the left side of the intersection as possible while paying attention to the pedestrians.
The intersection has low visibility, so you slow down to make sure that you can stop at the intersection anytime.
You pass through the intersection after watching out for traffic by looking right and left or checking for traffic in the mirror installed at the intersection.

options.statement: The bicycle traveling on the opposite lane may be going through the intersection, so you stop at the intersection until the bicycle has finished passing through the intersection.
A motorcycle may suddenly be passing through the intersection from behind the vehicle in the opposite lane, so you stop at the intersection.
You cannot see the pedestrian crossing on the right side even if the headlights are on, so you watch out for traffic carefully.

question: 6-93 You are slowing down to 10 km/h. What are you going to be careful about when you turn left?

options.statement: The bicycle is coming from the right side without its light on and the intersection has poor visibility, so you stop before the intersection and watch out for traffic before turning left.
A vehicle is approaching from behind, so you quickly go through the intersection.

There is a pedestrian on the left side near the intersection and it seems that it may take time for the pedestrian to cross the intersection, so you pass through the intersection before the pedestrian.

question: 6-94 You are driving at 40 km/h and you should have changed to the left lane corner. What are you going to be careful about when you are changing to the left lane?

options.statement: You need to check for traffic on the left lane, so you keep your eyes on the left side and the left side behind you.
A motorcycle is traveling on the left lane and there is a divider ahead. You slow down and indicate changing to the left lane while paying attention to both the motorcycle and the divider.
There is a divider just ahead, so you stop changing lanes and go straight to make a detour.

question: 6-95 You are driving at 30 km/h. A motorcycle stops on the side street on the left side. What are you going to be careful about when you are driving?

options.statement: The bicycle may be pulled by the dog and enter the middle of the road, so you pass the bicycle by entering the opposite lane and accelerating the speed while sounding the horn.
The motorcycle will let the bicycle and your vehicle go first, so you pass the bicycle by keeping the speed.
The motorcycle may come out of the street, so you slow down by paying attention to the motorcycle and you drive behind the bicycle until you pass the side street on the left side.
